definition: to compile/to draw up/to fabricate/to invent/to concoct/to make up/to cook up
to weave/to plait/to organize/to group/to arrange/to edit/to compile/to write/to compose/to fabricate
to make/to build/to manufacture/to invent/to fabricate/to go to/party (in a lawsuit or legal agreement)/crop/classifier for crops

sentences.english: He made up a story to explain his absence.
sentences.chinese: 他編造謊言爲他的缺席開脫。

sentences.english: I don't know how much was made up for the film.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道這部電影有多少內容是編造的。

sentences.english: You can easily fake up an excuse to avoid going out with him.
sentences.chinese: 爲避免同他一起外出，你可以很容易地編造一個藉口。

sentences.english: He's not such a fool as you assumed him to be.
sentences.chinese: 他們編造了一套謊言來愚弄人民。

sentences.english: She manufactured a false story to hide the facts.
sentences.chinese: 她編造瞎話以掩蓋事實。

sentences.english: Then, in the end who is fabricating lies?
sentences.chinese: 那麼，到底是誰在編造謊言呢？

sentences.english: If you're on a bad date, make up some excuse and get the heck out of there.
sentences.chinese: 如果你的約會很糟糕，那就編造一些理由閃人吧。

sentences.english: But ye are forgers of lies, ye are all physicians of no value.
sentences.chinese: 你們是編造謊言的，都是無用的醫生。

sentences.english: They weaved a web of lies to fool the people.
sentences.chinese: 他們編造了一套謊言來愚弄人民。
有警察是我編造的謊言。

sentences.english: Both stepsisters began making excuses about how their feet had swollen .
sentences.chinese: 兩姐妹開始編造各種理由說自己的腳浮腫了。

sentences.english: They pitched a story about finding the jewels.
sentences.chinese: 他們編造了一個找到寶石的故事。

sentences.english: It angers me that people would fabricate a story like that.
sentences.chinese: 人們編造這樣的謊話讓我感到憤怒。

sentences.english: She entrapped herself in the web of her own lies.
sentences.chinese: 她陷入了自己編造的謊話羅網。

sentences.english: Now you've really stopped making sense.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲你真的應該停止編造謊言了。

sentences.english: So he concocted a fiendish scheme to trick her into paying.
sentences.chinese: 於是他編造了一個殘忍的計劃，以誘騙她支付。

definition: to throw one's life in for/to haplessly give one's life for/to sacrifice oneself torturously working for another or for a group/to pour in one's utmost effort/to shed one's last ounce of strength for
lit. chasing the wind and clutching at shadows (idiom); fig. groundless accusations/to act on hearsay evidence
to sensationalize (idiom); deliberate exaggeration to scare people
to make a story or theory consistent/to give a plausible explanation/to plug the holes in one's story
to use the current topic to put over one's own ideas/to use sth as a pretext to make a fuss
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
frightening words to scare people (idiom); alarmist talk/reds under the beds
lit. wind from an empty cave (idiom)/fig. unfounded (story)/baseless (claim)
tone sandhi/modified tone/(music) to change key/modulation
